1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
a Levite or descendant of Levi

Chanani, the name of six Israelites
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

a head person (of any rank or class)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
an opening, i.e. door or gate
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

heat

they (only used when emphatic)

something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)

a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a guard (the man, the post or the prison); a deposit (figuratively); also (as observed) a usage (abstractly), or an example (concretely)

a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

roomy, in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent

a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
